page.title: 11TOURISM
page.content: WALKING. This is an ideal area for hill walkers, numerous paths and tracks lead to the famous Offas Dyke walk (Clawyd Offa). In addition there is the Moel Famau country park with well marked paths. FISHING & RIDING. Fly fishing is permitted by licence in the Garth resevoir. Pony trekking is a very popular pastime in this area, and is well catered for. CAMPING AND CARAVANS. The local people take a great interest in tourism in their area, and many of the local farms provide B.+ B., have camping facilities and limited space for caravans. PUBLIC CONVENIENCES. There are none in this area.
